metadata.title: CVE-2024-35366 on Ubuntu 24.10 (oracular) - medium
metadata.description:
FFmpeg n6.1.1 is Integer Overflow. The vulnerability exists in theparse_options function of sbgdec.c within the libavformat module. Whenparsing certain options, the software does not adequately validate theinput. This allows for negative duration values to be accepted withoutproper bounds checking.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-35366` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ffmpeg - 7.0
libavcodec-extra - 7.0
libavcodec-extra60 - 7.0
libavcodec60 - 7.0
libavdevice60 - 7.0
libavfilter-extra - 7.0
libavfilter-extra9 - 7.0
libavfilter9 - 7.0
libavformat-extra - 7.0
libavformat-extra60 - 7.0
libavformat60 - 7.0
libavutil58 - 7.0
libpostproc57 - 7.0
libswresample4 - 7.0
libswscale7 - 7.0
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ffmpeg package in oracular, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '7.0').
